author: Larry S
comment: This app appears​ to be as accurate as the other I have compared it too. The draw back for me is this app does not flow from screen to screen. I would like to see separate screens for temp, rain+wind, particulates and next 7 days. All at a swipe not having to tap. Radar section could be more detailed. It does work and you will know when you need to take your umbrella.

author: Tom Duensing
comment: I changed from a detailed weather app to this weather app.  It is very accurate, shows all the information you need, is easy to use, doesn't take up much space and is fast.  It has become my weather app of choice.  What is especially nice is that a gives you an accurate forecast summary for the upcoming week so you can just simply read the forecast. The map is nice but I would like to be able to view cloud cover too.  Sometimes the auto updating does not work.
title: Very accurate

author: Basement Coals
comment: Liked interface, has various related info, nicely organized. Dark theme option exists, its helpful to reduce battery usage. Now, locations (Locn) can b added manually w/o Locn service is ON. Only 2 Locns can b added in2 Remote Locn section. Its still using NonEncrypted data thru p/80 of Newark-Linode & Amazon Servers ! used v6.0.0.6, when reviewed. Reply: thanks 4 improving & respons, agn. Found the free dark-thm feat, also the paid Upg option to add upto 10 Locn. Changed review ratings & content. Thanks.

reply.author: Labrys Software
reply.content: you can add locations manually with an address or a city or basically anything androids geocoder can parse. you don't need location services to do this. shoot me an email and I can walk you through it

title: imho, 1ofThe Best Weather App :) Support For 2 Locations in Free Edition . This App Uses No Unnecessary System Lvl Permissions :)

author: Ciofu Liviu
comment: I bought this app because it uses the weather api DarkCloud has (or so I read), anyway it is accurate for my area. Also love the simple design approach and dark theme. I don't like he "weather station approach" with many graphs and analysis, I just want to quicly see weather for next 48 hours. Good job guys

author: nascent nascentt
comment: Clean, simple, useful.  The design of the main app and the widgets is stunning. Edit: the widget constantly breaks to the point of me not trusting it at all. Currently says last updated 12 hrs ago however I'm inclined to think this is actually days ago even manual refresh didn't fix. Have to regularly remove and reads the widget!

reply.author: Labrys Software
reply.content: Currently every hour. Will make this an option in the future.

author: Gary Clark
comment: Purchased this App thinking to help the Dev Develope this App. It's rather hard to understand that there hasn't been any updates in now over one year. With No Updates or New Features Added Doesn't Sound Like Dev Cares Much About Anything Other Than Grabbing a Few Bucks. Buyer Beware!!!

author: Matt c
comment: This is the best weather app I found as far as accuracy. Have seen it be accurate down to the minute only 4 stars because it could maybe look better graphically or be more user-friendly I don't really know. Definitely worth paying money for.
title: None better

author: shane fitzgerald-gale
comment: Really excellent weather app. This uses forecast.io which is the best I've come across. Unfortunately, most aid either overcomplicate things too much or its painfully slow, but this is fast, had enough complexity of your into that, but is simplicity itself is you're not. The widget is very customisable and allies either complexity or simplifier in both is short and long term forecasts. Wonderful app. I'm actually considering paying for it, which I never do. Edit: Have paid for it now. It's that good!

author: H. Muñoz
comment: Nice app but it shows icons for rain for just 8% chance of rain. At that low percentage is very very unlikely you will get any rain. For this reason I can't trust the icons so I'm forced to open the app to read the percent. Also no UV graph.

author: Gillie Almeida
comment: For weather, I used to start with NOAA and then branch out to a few other forecasts to get an "average" for the day. Now I  find myself only using Arcus. Great app with very accurate forecasting through the day.
title: Weather junkie here

author: Cathrine Daily
comment: My location is getting hit with a major ice storm and all the app is saying is snow. There is a big and dangerous difference between a half inch of snow and a half inch of ice. Thankfully I use more than one weather app and wasn't caught out in it.

author: Dennis Thompson
comment: We ride motorcycles and this app has saved us from getting wet several times.  When it says nearest rain is 30 minutes away it's never wrong by more than a minute or two.  We don't leave home without it.  Great Job Guys!

author: Dorothy Hohl-Lorenc
comment: As a person who uses a wheelchair, knowing how long it will continue to rain is so helpful! Getting my wheelchair in/out of my car takes time & I get drenched if it's raining. This app helps me decide if I should "wait it out." Thank you!
title: Best weather app!

author: Ron Curtis
comment: I have worked outside for many years, and it was always hit and miss with the weather. Not anymore. Arcus is the must have tool for outdoor activities, work or pleasure. In my use of the app it has been accurate to the minute. You can select another location you're travelling to for the weather before you arrive, absolutely brilliant. I can't rate this enough. UPDATE, this is still my go to weather after all the others I have tried. When you need to know the weather conditions in the next hour or day.
title: Arcus "works"

author: Tahina Narovana Andrianaivo
comment: Excuse me if it feels like I'm advertising for ARCUS weather. I dpent a whole year trying so many kind of weather apps that didn't fulfill my needs. Last week, I found ihis app on a forum and it's just the best weather app ever done. Thanks to the developers.
title: I actually love this app

author: Jaron Moore
comment: Even though this app has no kind of material design, it's full to the brim with weather info. There is a graph that let's you know when it'll start and stop raining. I was skeptical until just now. It was basically dead on. Would suggest this weather app to anyone. Good job, Dev!
title: Fan-tastic, app!

comment: The radar has no animation, has limitations in the zoom in/out. Why does it connect to Google maps and show us a picture of the location? I would rather see precipitation, clouds, snow, rain on a moving radar. Thanks in advance!
title: Nice except?

author: Kelly McGuire
comment: The app no longer restarts in my status bar when I reboot my phone.  I have to open the app for it to appear. I have tried changing the settings, restarting, and changing them back, but it still doesn't work.  Annoying bug, but the weather reports are still great.

author: Sarah Irvin
comment: Nice layout, great customisable widget, loads of info while maintaining minimalist feel. Love the fact I can have the 48h temperature forecast!! Have paid to remove adds and support the app as felt it was deserved (the ads were barely noticeable when they were there though. ) If map option also covered the UK this would get 5 stars :)
title: Best weather app out there

author: Joanna Brooks
comment: I'm not kidding when I say this is the most accurate weather app I've ever used. I trust it every minute of every day, even for tornados. Bonus that the layout is clean & minimalistic while containing as much detail as you want it to, and the widget is customizable.

author: Joe Cunningham
comment: I'm standing in a snowstorm and the app reports clear skies for the next 48 hours. This would be the best weather app available if only it were accurate
title: Pretty interface, pretty inaccurate

author: Tracy Martin
comment: Update - coincidentally right after I wrote this review, it started updating again.        WAS good but is not updating any more (2 days) - RESPONSE ERROR
title: Response error

author: Allyn Chrisman
comment: Great app for depth of data and one of the most comprehensive widgets available in a weather app. The app is smooth with no lag; but has a boring and dated interface design. It's a workhorse app providing the facts (and a lot of those), but with minimal effort to look good while doing it. The app utilizes Forecast.io as the source, which is less than ideal where I live - but I understand can be excellent in other regions.

author: Tyrone Slothrop
comment: And the "rain in 15 minutes" thing is great.  Answers the questions I most want to ask, and gives details others don't, e.g., rain starting/stopping in x minutes, nearest rain y miles SE, etc.
title: Brief, quick, to the point

author: Herb Nesbitt
comment: The app is great. The weather is innacurate at least for Pacific Northwest. And by inacurrate I mean it is wrong more often than right!

author: Andy Flacks
comment: Recently, after I close the app on my Nexus 5X running 7.0, I get a pop-up that Arcus has stopped responding. Please look into as I truly like this app.

author: FernandezExchange
comment: I used to love this app, but now has issues loading current data. Takes noticeably longer to update. Hope they fix soon.
title: What happened?

author: Dork Fish
comment: The best out of about 15 apps so far. Only thing that id like added is options to make the view format a default setting between grids or lists.

author: Michael Richardson
comment: It never updates the widgets.  Just looked at it; three days since the last update.    That's pretty bad for a weather app that tries to pass itself as a very detail oriented app.   It's fine if you want to know the weather for the last three days.

author: Andy Pakula
comment: Arcus is excellent. Its free version gives you everything you need. Bought the upgrade to support developers. It's a one - time test purchase price, unlike its slick competitor that charges EVERY Year and does no more than excellent Arcus.
I got out for the the widget. However,  even if you upgrade the widget would not update unless you press on it. Should update when flip to the screen with it. Otherwise it is quite good
title: Like it.

author: Tess Bond
comment: This information I get from this app is amazing. The widget is completely awesome and customizable. The developer is very responsive to issues and suggestions. I will always have room on my phone for this app!
title: Amazing App!

author: MD Weatherbee
comment: It's got a map, albeit a useless one. Check AccuWeather for a map done right. Get that done and this would be just about perfect.

author: Douglas Dickinson
comment: "Drizzle stopping in 3 min., starting again 8 min. later". -- Perfect, exactly what I need to know when I'm going out to walk the dog.  For me this doesn't replace a full featured weather app, but if you live where the weather changes quickly this is awesome.

author: Rebecca Shappell
comment: Completely inaccurate. Forecast is totally different than every other weather service and very wrong. Widget & status bar never update unless you go into the app. No response from dev

author: Adam Beaudoin
comment: Excellent app, purchased. One feature that is conspicuously absent, though, is the ability to see previous days' temperatures. I'd really like the option to have my widget say "a little colder than yesterday". I've seen this feature on other apps, can you add it to Arcus?
title: Almost perfect

author: Mike S
comment: Even with the full version it doesn't refresh automatically no matter what refresh interval is set. I have to manually click on it every time I look at the weather.
title: Would be great

author: Matthew Cantway
comment: This app is very useful and the interface is simple. Most of the other weather apps I've tried are laggy and use alot of resources.

author: Chris Miller
comment: Works well, worth the money. Now that DarkSky has re-combined with Forecast.io I am curious how the new DarkSky app will compete against this one as far as weather apps. Arcus has always been great though, so no reason to switch.

author: Mike O'Connor
comment: Gorgeous widget and generally accurate weather readings. However, the hourly forecast 2 hrs out said "drizzle", when it actually turned out to be a severe thunderstorm with 70+ mph gusting winds. That is not ok. It's a serious safety concern for a person using this app as their sole weather source. Anyone with even passing knowledge of how to read a radar would've seen that 2 hr forecast to be grossly inaccurate, while somebody with experience reading radars could've known that to be inaccurate at least 8 hrs out. I have the paid version that allows for updating the widget on the home screen, which is convenient so long as it's a reliable report. I'm not sure I can justify using this app anymore.
